text:
This is the reason why I use Emacs as my main mail client: I can adapt it to my workflow.

But the mail client example also illustrates the difficulty of the problem. What would the user-extensible mail client look like? Some users would want a very simple extension system for adding the occasional button. Others would want more sophisticated programmability.  But how many users would be willing to learn a programming environments specific to a mail client?

The other approach is the Emacs Way: have an extensible platform and implement the mail client in it. Learning the environment is then more attractive, because it covers multiple use cases. But it's also more difficult. And then, if the idea ever catches on widely, we will see tens of such environments, all incompatible, and we are back to the extensible-app situation where learning the extensibility mechanism is hardly worth the effort.
